docs.snippet: For all their distrust of him personally, for all of their anger at his deceit, the unmistakable truth of this pennant race is that the Yankees need Alex Rodriguez....
docs.lead_paragraph: For all their distrust of him personally, for all of their anger at his deceit, the unmistakable truth of this pennant race is that the Yankees need Alex Rodriguez.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column contends that no matter how much New York Yankees may disdain or distrust Alex Rodriguez, he remains key factor in their pursuit of the pennant.

headline.main: Like Him or Not, Yankees Rely on Rodriguez
headline.print_headline: Like Him or Not, Yankees Rely on Rodriguez

docs.snippet: The right-hander Masahiro Tanaka, 24, is undefeated in Japan this season and could be pitching in the major leagues in 2014....
docs.lead_paragraph: The right-hander Masahiro Tanaka, 24, is undefeated in Japan this season and could be pitching in the major leagues in 2014.
docs.abstract: Japanese league pitcher Masahiro Tanaka goes undefeated in 2013, pushing his record to 20-0; dating to last season, Tanaka's 24 consecutive wins matches a record set by Carl Hubbell in 1936-37; he could be making his debut in Major League Baseball in 2014.

headline.main: Japanese Pitcher (20-0) Is Set for a Major Move
headline.print_headline: Japanese Pitcher (20-0) Is Set for a Major Move

docs.snippet: Pitcher Matt Harvey would rather avoid surgery on his right elbow, which could sideline him for a year, while Ruben Tejada is looking to work his way back to the majors....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pitcher Matt Harvey would rather avoid surgery on his right elbow, which could sideline him for a year, while Ruben Tejada is looking to work his way back to the majors.
docs.abstract: Future remains unclear for New York Mets pitcher Matt Harvey, who wants to avoid elbow surgery that could sideline him for a year, while shortstop Ruben Tejada is looking to work his way back from the minors.

headline.main: Harvey and Tejada Are Joined by Uncertain Status for 2014
headline.print_headline: Harvey and Tejada Are Joined By Uncertain Status for 2014

docs.snippet: The Yankees, feeling the pressure of a tight race for the second A.L. wild-card spot, rallied from a three-run deficit to beat the Orioles. But the Yankees had three more players leave the game with injuries....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees, feeling the pressure of a tight race for the second A.L. wild-card spot, rallied from a three-run deficit to beat the Orioles. But the Yankees had three more players leave the game with injuries.
docs.abstract: New York Yankees beat Baltimore Orioles, 7-5, but Yankees have three more players leave the game with injuries.

headline.main: Yankees Climb Back, but With More Injuries
headline.print_headline: Yankees Climb Back, But With More Injuries

docs.snippet: If the agreement is completed, Yankees games will move from WCBS-AM to WFAN next season, displacing the Mets from their longtime radio home....
docs.lead_paragraph: If the agreement is completed, Yankees games will move from WCBS-AM to WFAN next season, displacing the Mets from their longtime radio home.
docs.abstract: Tentative new radio deal would put New York Yankees on WFAN Radio for 10 years at rate of $15 million per year; agreement would bump New York Mets from station that has carried their games since its inception in 1987.

headline.main: Yankees Appear Headed to WFAN, Bumping Mets
headline.print_headline: Yankees Look To Be Moving To WFAN, Bumping Mets

byline.original: By RICHARD SANDOMIR and TIM ROHAN
